Name: Requiring an annual report indicating the quantities and locations of automated external defibrillators placed in public places.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to requiring an annual report indicating the quantities and locations of automated external defibrillators placed in public places

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee

Attachments.Name: Minutes of the Stated Meeting - November 3, 2022

Summary: This bill would require the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene to issue a report on the quantities and locations of automated external defibrillators placed in public places.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:


      Section 1. Subdivision d of section 17-188 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended to read as follows:
      d. Reports.  The department shall conduct a comprehensive study and submit a report to the mayor and the council twelve months after the effective date of the local law that added this section.  Such report shall include, but not be limited to, the quantities and locations of automated external defibrillators placed in public places pursuant to subdivision b of this section and the identification of any additional locations throughout the city of New York that warrant the placement of automated external defibrillators.  [Twenty-four months after the effective date of the local law that added this section] No later than March 1, 2023, and annually thereafter [for the next succeeding three years], the department shall submit to the mayor and the council a report indicating the quantities and locations of automated external defibrillators placed in public places pursuant to subdivision b of this section. 
      � 2. This local law takes effect immediately. 
      




IB
LS #8934
10/18/2022
